item.title: GTA 6 Still Confirmed For November With Summer Marketing Blitz Planned
item.content:encoded:
Rockstarâ€™s parent company, Take-Two Interactive, reconfirmed that Grand Theft Auto 6 is set to launch this November during its quarterly earnings report and conference. Take-Twoâ€™s CEO even revealed that marketing for the long-awaited crime sim will start this summer.

On Tuesday, as spotted in a press release about Take-Twoâ€™s Q3 2026 earnings results by IGN, the company confirmed that it plans to start marketing Grand Theft Auto 6 sometime in the summer, which seems to indicate that the game, which has been delayed a few times now, is actually (for real) getting close to launching later this year.

Meanwhile, Zelnick told newsletter The Game Business this when asked about the confirmation that GTA 6â€˜s marketing blitz was just a few months away: â€œYou know me pretty well, for me to even say weâ€™ve got marketing beats coming this summer is a huge departure from what I usually say, which is that our labels will make marketing announcements.â€

In an earnings call later in the day, Zelnick was asked how much marketing a game like GTA 6 even needs. He assured investors that Take-Two and Rockstar werenâ€™t going to â€œsit back and relax.â€

â€œI think the opposite is true,â€ said Zelnick. â€œWe are in the business of eating red meat for breakfast. I think weâ€™ll be having a lot more red meat in the coming months. We are very fortunate that the consumer anticipation for GTA 6 is huge. And one does have to be judicious with how one markets such an extraordinary product. Rest assured, I think youâ€™ll be pretty astonished by the creativity that Rockstarâ€™s marketing team brings to consumers in the coming months.â€

Normally, Take-Two doesnâ€™t provide details like this, opting to let Rockstar provide those details later, so this is a good sign that GTA 6â€˜s development is on track. You donâ€™t start committing to expensive marketing plans and telling the press about them unless everyone involved is very confident in the gameâ€™s development status. And yes, in the past, Zelnick has told investors and the public he felt good about GTA 6â€˜s release date, and then it was delayed. But in those cases, he and Take-Two hadnâ€™t committed to a marketing timeframe like this before. And while things can always change, at least for now it seems GTA 6 is finally, for real, actually launching as planned on November 19.
